document.docAuthor: Schmidt, C. A. & Shattuck, S. O.
document.masterDocTitle: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

subSubSection.paragraph:
Brown (1976) revised the species-level taxonomy of
Odontomachus .
His keys to
Odontomachus species
are slightly outdated but are still the most complete for the world fauna.

O.alius Sorger & Zettel, 2011
: Philippines ( Cebu I.).

O. animosus Smith, F., 1860
: New Guinea

O. floresensis Brown, 1976
: Indonesia ( Flores Island )

O. malignus Smith, F., 1859
: New Guinea

O. nigriceps Smith, F., 1860
: New Guinea

O. relictus Deyrup & Cover, 2004
: United States

O. schoedli Sorger & Zettel, 2011
: Philippines (Luzon I.)

O. scifictus Sorger & Zettel, 2011
: Philippines ( Camiguin I.)

O. simillimus Smith, F., 1858
: Fiji Islands

O. tyrannicus Smith, F., 1859
: Indonesia (Aru Island)

†
O. pseudobauri De Andrade, 1994
: Dominican Amber

†
O. spinifer De Andrade, 1994
: Dominican Amber
